bill_title: require certain private organizations providing temporary care, shelter, or detention to children to meet certain standards.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to require certain private organizations providing temporary care, shelter, or detention to children to meet certain standards. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 26-7A-23 be amended to read as follows: 26-7A-23. A board of county commissioners may provide and maintain at public expense temporary care, shelter, or detention facilities, sight and sound separated from adult prisoners, where children coming within the provisions of this chapter or chapter 26-8A, 26-8B, 26-8C, or § § 26-11A-13 and 26-11A-14, may, if necessary or appropriate, be placed for temporary care, temporary custody, shelter, or detention as designated by the court, or temporary detention or shelter by the Department of Corrections. Any private organization under contract with a county to provide temporary care, shelter, or detention for children shall meet the standards of care established by the Department of Social Services pursuant to § 26-4-7. Sections 26-11A-19 and 26-7A-94 governs govern the costs of custodial care of children. 350 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.027 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.
